questions.question: What C++ feature resolves the diamond problem?
questions.explanation: Virtual inheritance ensures only one copy of base class exists.

questions.question: What principle states subclasses must be substitutable for base classes?
questions.explanation: LSP ensures derived classes maintain base class contracts.

questions.question: What technique creates inheritance relationships at runtime?
questions.explanation: Delegation simulates inheritance by forwarding method calls.

questions.question: What inheritance approach uses has-a instead of is-a?
questions.explanation: Composition builds complex objects from simpler ones.

questions.question: What allows Python to support multiple inheritance safely?
questions.explanation: MRO defines the order for searching inherited methods.

questions.question: What mechanism prevents method hiding in child classes?
questions.explanation: Virtual functions enable dynamic method resolution.

questions.question: What keyword makes methods inherit implementation in interfaces?
questions.explanation: Default methods in interfaces provide concrete implementations.

questions.question: What design pattern uses inheritance to define algorithm skeleton?
questions.explanation: Template method defines steps while subclasses provide details.

questions.question: What term describes tight coupling in deep hierarchies?
questions.explanation: Changes to base classes can break derived classes.

questions.question: What technique allows interfaces to evolve without breaking implementations?
questions.explanation: Default methods add functionality to interfaces without breaking code.
